item.title: Digimon Fans Need to Circle March 19 on Their Calendars
item.description:
Summary

  • Digimon Con will livestream on YouTube March 19 at 10 PM Eastern.
  • New information about Digimon Story: Time Stranger will be revealed.
  • Time Stranger's release date may be announced during the livestream.

The annual Digimon fan convention, Digimon Con, will host a special livestream on YouTube, starting in the late night of March 19 in North America. The upcoming Digimon livestream will include more news about the highly-anticipated Digimon Story: Time Stranger , which is scheduled to be released later in 2025.

First revealed during the February 12 PlayStation State of Play broadcast, Digimon Story: Time Stranger is the franchise's first new game in nearly three years, following the 2022 visual novel game Digimon Survive . As part of the Digimon Story RPG series, Time Stranger will see the human and the Digital World collide once again, as players uncover the mysteries behind the appearance of Digimon throughout the real world. Like its predecessor, Digimon Story: Cyber Sleuth , Time Stranger will feature turn-based RPG combat and monster-taming that will give players the means to befriend and battle all kinds of new and classic Digital Monsters.

Although information about Digimon Story: Time Stranger remains light at the time of writing, Digimon fans will soon get a chance to learn more. According to the official Digimon portal site, Digimon Con will begin its livestream on Wednesday, March 19, at 10:00 PM Eastern, on the DigimonOfficialJP YouTube channel, which will be available to all viewers for free. The site stated that updates about Digimon Story: Time Stranger would be revealed during the show, and reconfirmed that the game would launch in 2025. However, Digimon Con did not elaborate on any further information.

Digimon Con Will Host A YouTube Stream On March 19

  • The annual Digimon Con event will have a YouTube broadcast on March 19 at 10:00 PM Eastern.
  • More information about Digimon Story: Time Stranger will be shown during the livestream.
  • Time Stranger's release date is among the possible Digimon Con reveals.
  • Other announcements about the Digimon franchise will be discussed.

It remains to be seen if gameplay footage or the release date for Time Stranger will be revealed during the upcoming Digimon Con.While the live YouTube broadcast will be primarily in Japanese, a subtitled English archive of the 2025 Digimon Con livestream should also be available for global viewers to enjoy shortly afterward. Alongside news about Digimon Story: Time Stranger , Digimon Con will cover various aspects of the franchise.

News concerning the Digimon anime series, new trading cards, toys, and comic books will be discussed during the broadcast. Additionally, the 25th anniversary of the Digimon Adventure 02 anime, which is a direct sequel to 1999's Digimon Adventure , will be observed at Digimon Con with various goods for fans to peruse.

Though several questions about Digimon Story: Time Stranger remain unanswered, fans eager to experience a grittier version of the Digital World will not have much longer to wait for new information. Only time will tell what surprises await Digimon fans during Digimon Con.

item.title: Toby Fox Provides Update on Deltarune Chapters 3 and 4
item.description:
Summary

  • Deltarune developer Toby Fox says that console testing for Chapters 3 and 4 is still underway.
  • The team is also ensuring that save files from the demo carry over to the main title on consoles.
  • Chapters 3 and 4 will be released simultaneously sometime in 2025.

Deltarune developer Toby Fox has provided a new update regarding Chapters 3 and 4 of the episodic RPG, which are both scheduled to be released sometime in 2025. As Chapter 2 was released over three years ago, fans are eager to get their hands on the next pieces of Deltarune to continue Kris, Susie, and Ralsei's story.

Featuring similar gameplay to Fox's acclaimed 2015 title Undertale , Deltarune 's story will span seven chapters in total, with Chapters 1 and 2 released in 2018 and 2021, respectively. The available entries have been applauded by players and critics alike for their sense of humor, characters, and soundtrack, the latter of which was also composed by Fox. In December 2024, the developer stated that Deltarune Chapters 3 and 4 were nearly complete, though the bug-testing phase and translation phases would take some time. Regardless, fans are gearing up for a 2025 launch, with a new update from Fox helping to temper expectations regarding an exact release window.

In a new BlueSky post, Fox offered some details about the current status of Deltarune Chapters 3 and 4, confirming that console testing is still underway. While the developer notes that there are fewer bugs than before, there is still a lot of content to test, and the PlayStation 5 version has yet to be tested at all. Additionally, the team needs to ensure that save files from the demo carry over to the main title on consoles, which has only just become possible. While this may sound like bad news at first glance, Fox previously stated that Deltarune Chapters 3 and 4 would "100% come out in 2025."

Toby Fox Still Aiming to Release Deltarune Chapters 3 and 4 in 2025

In July 2024, Fox announced that Chapter 4 was fully playable, though some polish was still needed. Both new chapters will be released at the same time across all platforms, marking a major change, as both Chapters 1 and 2 of Deltarune were first released for PC before being ported to consoles. Chapter 5 is currently in production, with Fox confirming in December 2024 that progress was "steady" on all fronts.

While Deltarune has been well received by players, its popularity hasn't yet swelled to the level of Undertale , which continues to inspire fans nearly a decade after its release. The 2015 game's unique approach to battle, in which players can choose to resolve enemy encounters peacefully, carried over to Deltarune , and fans are eager to see if any other aspects of Fox's magnum opus will appear in the forthcoming entries to his current RPG project.

item.title: Sniper Elite Resistance Guides Hub: Collectibles, Kills Lists, Tips, & More
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Sniper Elite Resistance Tips & Tricks
  • Sniper Elite Resistance Collectibles
    • Collectibles By Mission
    • Collectibles By Type
  • Sniper Elite Resistance Kill List Challenges
  • Sniper Elite Resistance Equipment
  • Sniper Elite Resistance Mission Objectives
    • Mission 1
    • Mission 3
    • Mission 2
    • Mission 3
    • Mission 4
  • Sniper Elite Resistance Achievements & Trophies
  • Sniper Elite Resistance DLC Missions
    • Lights, Camera, ACHTUNG!

Sniper Elite: Resistance consists of nine missions, the vast majority of which are filled with collectibles to find, objectives to complete, and equipment to secure. While the methods that are used to address these various aspects of the game are typically straightforward, players may occasionally encounter situations in Sniper Elite: Resistance with which they need some help.

Providing that help is the precise purpose of this collection of guides, and players can learn how to find all the game's collectibles, how to approach its seven Kill List challenges, and more in the sections that are below. Additionally, fans who are struggling to get started with Sniper Elite: Resistance can find several guides that offer beginner tips and cover basic mechanics in this hub, and those guides should allow players to establish a foundation that can be used to complete the game.

This Sniper Elite: Resistance guides hub is a work-in-progress, and it will continue to be updated in the upcoming days and weeks.

  • Sniper Elite Resistance Tips & Tricks

    While many of the gameplay systems at the core of Sniper Elite: Resistance may be intuitive, some players may have difficulty finding their feet in the early hours of the game. For those players who are struggling to get started, the following guides provide tips that, when followed, should make it possible to get through the game's nine missions.

    • How Long to Beat
    • Best Difficulty Settings
    • Beginner Tips
    • Beginner Tips for Multiplayer
    • Invasion Guide
    • Tips and Tricks for Survival
    • Best Skills To Unlock Early
    • Best PC Settings
    • How To Get Ammo
    • How To Use Binoculars
    • How To Destroy A Tank
    • How to Unlock All Starting Locations

  • Sniper Elite Resistance Collectibles

    There are more than 100 collectibles in Sniper Elite: Resistance , ranging from Propaganda Posters, to Classified Documents, and beyond. While those collectibles are entirely optional, some players will undoubtedly be interested in finding them all. The following guides will assist with that endeavor, and they have been organized by mission and collectible type.

    • Collectibles By Mission

      • Mission 2 Collectible Locations (Dead Drop)
      • Mission 3 Collectible Locations (Sonderzuge Sabotage)
      • Mission 4 Collectible Locations (Collision Course)
      • Mission 5 Collectible Locations (Devil's Cauldron)
      • Mission 6 Collectible Locations (Assault on Fort Rouge)
      • Mission 7 Collectible Locations (Lock, Stock and Barrels)
      • Mission 8 Collectible Locations (End of the Line)

    • Collectibles By Type

      • Propaganda Poster Locations
      • Stone Eagle Locations
      • Workbench Locations

  • Sniper Elite Resistance Kill List Challenges

    Kill List challenges are optional objectives that appear in the vast majority of Sniper Elite: Resistance 's missions. Players who complete those challenges by killing their targets in specific ways will be awarded with special weapons, and the following guides detail how to fulfill each Kill List requirement.

    • All Kill List Challenges
    • Kill Philo Beck with a Rat Bomb (Mission 2 Kill Challenge)
    • Kill Claude La Ronde with Cargo (Mission 3 Kill Challenge)
    • Kill Ludwig Spiegel by Making Him Fall From the Dam (Mission 4 Kill Challenge)
    • Kill Eloi Coste with an LMG (Mission 5 Kill Challenge)
    • Kill Uwe Schoene with a Coal Torpedo (Mission 6 Kill Challenge)
    • Kill Aldo Riese with Poison (Mission 7 Kill Challenge)
    • Kill Hermann Gottschalk with a Gas Explosion (Mission 8 Kill Challenge)

  • Sniper Elite Resistance Equipment

    This group of guides will help players unlock several attachments, which they can use to customize their weapons in Sniper Elite: Resistance . Additionally, there is a guide that details the game’s best weapons, and fans can use the information that it presents to determine which guns they should customize with attachments.

    • Best Weapons
    • 6x Pistol Scope
    • SMG Extended Magazine
    • First Rifle Suppressor

  • Sniper Elite Resistance Mission Objectives

    While Sniper Elite: Resistance ’s waypoint system makes it quite easy to address most mission objectives, there are tasks that may leave players slightly confused. The following guides look to address those tasks, and they may prove helpful to fans who are stuck on a particular mission objective.

    • Mission 1

      • Pressurize The Dam

    • Mission 3

      • Find the Second Safehouse
      • Search For Superweapon Clues

    • Mission 2

      • Find Vertigo's Dead Drop At Basilica
      • Locate the Tunnel Entrance in the Library Gardens

    • Mission 3

      • Find the Second Safehouse
      • Search For Superweapon Clues

    • Mission 4

      • Eliminate All Bouncing Bomb Intelligence

  • Sniper Elite Resistance Achievements & Trophies

    There are more than 60 achievements for players to earn in Sniper Elite: Resistance . Fans can pursue some of those trophies with the help of the guides that appear earlier in this hub, and this selection of guides will help them earn the rest.

    • Trophy/Achievement Guide
    • Three Birds One Stone Achievement/Trophy Guide

  • Sniper Elite Resistance DLC Missions

    Sniper Elite: Resistance is set to receive several DLC missions. The following guides will help players find all the collectibles, earn all the achievements, and more in that optional content.

    • Lights, Camera, ACHTUNG!

      • All Collectible Locations
      • All Workbench Locations
      • All Starting Locations
      • He Did Nazi-It Coming Achievement Guide

item.title: GameStop Hosting Buy 2 Get 1 Free Sale for PS4 Games
item.description:
Summary

  • GameStop is having a Buy 2 Get 1 Free sale for PS4 games, but it's limited to pre-owned copies.
  • Only the cheapest game will be free, so consumers should keep that in mind.
  • It's unclear how long the promotion will last.

GameStop is currently hosting a Buy 2 Get 1 Free sale for PlayStation 4 games. This is an excellent opportunity for PS4 or PS5 owners to acquire new games at GameStop at excellent prices, but it’s important to note that, as usual, only pre-owned games are available for this promotion, rather than brand-new copies.

GameStop is currently the largest video game retailer in the United States. The company is known for its frequent Buy 2 Get 1 Free game promotions, which allow customers to purchase three games for the price of two.

Now, GameStop has announced the return of the popular Buy 2 Get 1 Free game sale, but this time only for used PS4 discs. As usual, only the cheapest of the three games purchased will be free, so consumers should keep that in mind. Gamers will have a wide range of titles to choose from, as there are 1,672 games included in the sale. Some of these titles include widely popular PS4 games such as 2018’s God of War , Grand Theft Auto 5 , Red Dead Redemption 2 , Uncharted 4: Thief’s End , Marvel’s Spider-Man , Days Gone . Obviously, these are only some of the many titles available in the promotion. While these games can also be run on the PS5, it’s important to note that they will not run as native PS5 titles, though.

GameStop Buy 2 Get 1 Free PS4 Games

  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  • Days Gone
  • God of War
  • Grand Theft Auto 5
  • Marvel's Spider-Man
  • Mortal Kombat 11
  • NBA 2K25
  • Red Dead Redemption 2
  • The Last of Us: Part 2
  • Uncharted 4: A Thief's End

At the moment, it’s unclear how long the deal will last, as GameStop generally does not disclose this information. In any case, GameStop customers would be wise to purchase their desired products as soon as possible to avoid losing the chance of saving money.

Despite offering these excellent promotions, GameStop continues to close down physical stores in the United States. Last month, GameStop silently closed multiple stores, disappointing some regular customers.

Last year, GameStop also left Germany, reducing its overall presence in Europe. Before stopping all the activities, the number of stores in the country had already decreased from 200 to around 70. Fortunately, the company’s online presence continues to be strong, and sales such as the current Buy 2 Get 1 Free promotion are still important for gamers who want to save when acquiring physical media.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail - Every God and Hero From Greek Mythology Referenced in Amphoreus So Far
item.description:
Honkai: Star Rail ’s third update introduced the new planet Amphoreus. This new planet is filled with references to Greek and Roman mythology, from its name to its characters and beyond. But these references aren’t just specifically mentioning Greek and Roman gods and heroes, Honkai: Star Rail ’s new planet has a distinctly Grecian feel to its design. Nevertheless, with Greek mythology’s gods and heroes making such an immense impact throughout pop culture, it's no surprise that Amphoreus is filled with many references to these mighty warriors.

In order to keep this article on the shorter side, this article defines a reference to a hero or god from Greek or Roman mythology when the name of that god or hero is mentioned. This narrows the pool of references as several of Amphoreus’ characters seem to pay homage to Greek and Roman gods or heroes without using the same names. Additionally, references to monsters, philosophers, and Greece and Rome’s many key historical players are excluded from this article.

Amphoreus NPCs Have Familiar Names

Amphoreus has over eighty NPCs and that number will keep climbing as future updates for the new planet are already scheduled. Yet, some of these NPCs have more bearing on Honkai: Star Rail than others.

Some of the smaller NPCs have big names to look up to. For example, Daidalos, the Chief Engineer of Kremnos Arena, is briefly mentioned in the Arena Maintenance Log. His name is a clear reference to Daedalus, one of the most famous engineers in Greek mythology and the creator of the Minotaur’s Labyrinth and father to Icarus. Daidalos’ name is proof of how dedicated to immersive storytelling HoYoverse is. This character has only shown up by name so far in Honkai: Star Rail , yet this naming choice is immediately revealing.

Other small-time NPCs that players actually interact with feature some of the most recognizable names from Greek and Roman myths. Characters like Gaia, Peleus, Cassondra, and Iason practically have the same names as the Greek gods and heroes they are referencing. Gaia is clearly based on Mother Earth, Peleus is named after the father of Achilles, Cassondra, who acts as a fortune-teller in Janusopolis, is a reference to the Oracle Cassandra, and Iason is only one letter away from the hero, Jason. Iason notably names the dromases after other Greek myths, with their names being Asterion, Euphemus, Castor and Pollux, and Heracles.

There are a few names that partially obscure the characters they are referencing, like Demetria, Apollonia, Aphrea, and Ulixes. Star Rail players caught up on their Greek mythology will know that Demetria and Apollonia are references to the Greek gods Demeter and Apollo respectively. However, Ulixes is the Latin form of “Ulysses”, another name for the Greek hero Odysseus. Aphrea is also a tricky situation. While Aphrea sounds similar to Aphrodite, the link that clearly binds the Greek goddess of love to Aphrea is the character’s marriage to Vulcan, which is the Roman title for Hephaestus. Aphrodite and Hephaestus are married, confirming that Aphrea was named after the love goddess.

Roman mythology has its fair share of NPC references as well. NPCs Bacchus and Fortuna are both named after Roman gods. Bacchus is the Roman form of the Grecian Dionysus and Fortuna is the Roman goddess of luck. However, one of the more important NPCs in Amphoreus’ storyline is based on a Grecian character. Elder Caenis of the Council of Elders seems to be modeled after Caeneus.

Titans Reference Greek Mythology Constantly

Amphoreus’ many titans also clearly reference Greek and Roman mythology. Titans like Thanatos, Mnestia, and Zagreus all directly reference Greek gods with their names. Thanatos is the Greek personification of death, a fitting name for the Death Titan. Mnestia and Zagreus are more obscure references. Mnestia is likely derived from Mnemosyne, the Greek goddess of memory, and Zagreus seems to be an Orphic version of Dionysus. These names are fitting for Titans that represent romance and trickery.

Titans Cerces and Oronyx, who could possibly be one of the Chrysos Heirs, could be referencing Greek gods and heroes in their names as well. Cerces sounds similar to Circe, a sorceress that has appeared in several adventures, most notably the Odyssey. Oronyx seems to refer to the goddess of night, Nyx. Considering the Titan’s tie to Evernight, this reference seems logical.

However, Kephale has the most obvious reference to a character from Greek mythology despite not sharing a name. The Titan Father of Amphoreus is shown holding up the sky, a direct reference to Atlas. Missing Kephale on this list would be lunacy despite the fact that he technically does not fit the guidelines set at the beginning of this article.

The Chrysos Heirs Subtly Reference Greek Mythology

The Chrysos Heirs are arguably the most notable characters in Amphoreus, as they will allegedly all be playable characters. Aglaea, who was introduced to Honkai: Star Rail in Version 3.0, was the first Chrysos Heir to join the game. She shares her name with one of the Greek charities. Mydeimos, who will be joining in Honkai: Star Rail Version 3.1, seems to share a name with Deimos, the Greek god of terror and son of Aphrodite and Ares. This name is fitting considering that Deimos takes the Path of Destruction and seeks the Coreflame of Strife.

Two unreleased and alleged Chrysos Heirs also reference Greek mythology. Hyacine, who is currently an NPC but was confirmed as a Chrysos Heir in the Golden Epic trailer, could be directly referencing Hyacinth. This tragic character was the lover of Apollo before he was struck down by a jealous former lover. Phainon shares a similar role to Hyacine, as he has been confirmed to be a Chrysos Heir in the Golden Epic trailer but is currently an NPC. His name could be a reference to Phaenon, a sky god specifically of the star Cronus.

HoYoverse has also referred to Greek and Roman heroes and gods through the names of locations, specifically Janusopolis. This name is derived from Janus, the Roman god of doorways, which perfectly suits the City of the Thousand Gates. Janus is also referred to in Amphoreus’ history as the Passage Titan. Even readables have received the reference treatment, with the “Dromas Herakles’ Twelve Trails” being available for players in the Grove of Epiphany. These constant references show how dedicated Honkai: Star Rail is to Amphoreus’ theming. Future versions will surely uncover more references to Greek and Roman gods and heroes.

,
